byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras is putting officials in charge of day-to-day talks who are less polarizing than the finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis.

headline.print_headline: Greece Says It Is Changing the Team That Negotiates With Creditors
headline.main: Greece Says It Is Changing Team That Negotiates With Creditors

snippet: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras is putting officials in charge of day-to-day talks who are less polarizing than the finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis.
abstract: Greek Prime Min Alexis Tsipras's government announces change to negotiating team working with international creditors, saying that Deputy Foreign Min Euclid Tsakalotos will take over day-to-day discussions; Tsipras stresses that Yanis Varoufakis will remain in charge of negotiations, but change is seen as acknowledgment that Varoufakis's outspoken approach has tried patience of eurozone negotiators.
